AVSEC  ORDER NO.  22 /2011   
 
Subject:-    
Approval of  appropriate  items  to be sued as   Covert  Test  Pieces 
 
 
The following items have been  approved by the Commissioner to be  used  by 
the  BCAS  auditors / inspectors  while  conducting covert  test  at the airports  to judge 
the  alertness and professional efficiency of  screeners:- 
 
(i) 
Inert improvised  explosive  device concealed  in a briefcase comprising  
the essential components like: dummy detonator, fuse, switch, battery  
and item  alike  plastic  explosive but  not  explosive. 
(ii) 
Toy pistol made of  brass or  steel or  iron  when to be  concealed  in 
cabin baggage. 
(iii) 
Toy pistol made of  plastic   when to be concealed  on person. 
(iv) 
Knife , pen knife. 
(v) 
An IED  as  mentioned  in para (i)  above  to be concealed  in a  laptop. 
(vii) 
Fake Aerodrome  Entry Permit for test  at the access control check points. 
 
2. 
The  above dummy items are  also approved  by  COSCA to   be  used  by  other  
entities  like  Airport Operators, ASG/ APSU,  Aircraft Operators, Regulated  Agents, 
Caterers who are  responsible  for  enforcement of  quality control measures. They  shall  
make  necessary  provisions  in their  Security Programmes. Samples  of these  items   
shall be  approved by  the concerned   RDCOS, BCAS. 
 
3.     This AVSEC Order shall   be implemented  with immediate  effect. 
 
4.     This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA).
